intro: Cacalia andersonii, commonly known as Anderson's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
